p: Prenylflavonoids represent a class of flavonoids with at least one prenyl or geranyl substituent in the ring [ 49]. It was established that the prenyl substituent significantly alters the biological activity of corresponding flavonoids, likely due to the increased lipophilicity that improves the binding affinity towards biological membranes [ 49]. Except for the case of estrogenicity of genistein [ 78], the shared observation is that prenylation elevates the biological effect of nonprenylated moieties, both phloroglucinol derivatives and flavonoids [ 86, 87, 88].
